document.title: The Rhetoric of Empathy: Ethical Foundations of Dialogical Communication
document.abstract: Peter Elbow's "Believing Game" can function as an ethical strategy and can be understood in terms of humanistic rhetorical traditions from Martin Buber to Carl Rogers and Michael Polanyi.

field.value: Nathaniel Teich is now Professor Emeritus at the University of Oregon, where he taught literature and writing courses for more than 32 years. He has published on poets and literary theories of the British romantic movement, writing assessment, imagery, and rhetorical theory. In the field of rhetoric and communication, he has focused on non-adversarial approaches to argumentation and problemsolving based on the work of psychologist Carl Rogers.
